section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.p1: TheYAS Law (“we”, “our”, “us”) is committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the safe handling of your personal data.
section1.p2: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, share, store, and protect your personal information when using our website, platform, and services (collectively, the “Platform”).

section2.title: 2. Information We Collect
section2.p1: We collect personal data that you provide directly, such as name, email, phone number, and legal inquiry details.
section2.p2: We also collect automatic data such as device info, IP address, cookies, usage patterns, and analytics.
section2.p3: Additionally, we may receive optional data such as uploaded documents or lawyer profile details.
section2.list1: Name, email address, phone number, password, profile photo, and date of birth
section2.list2: Legal credentials, bar association membership, practice areas, education, experience, certifications, and professional biography
section2.list3: Billing address, payment method details (processed securely through third-party payment processors)
section2.list4: Case details, legal questions, documents, communications, and consultation records
section2.list5: Messages exchanged through our Platform, customer support inquiries, and feedback

section22.heading: 2.2 Information Collected Automatically
section22.list1: IP address, browser type and version, operating system, device identifiers, and hardware model
section22.list2: Pages visited, features used, time spent on pages, links clicked, search queries, and interaction patterns
section22.list3: General geographic location based on IP address (with your consent, precise location for certain features)
section22.list4: We use cookies, web beacons, and similar technologies to enhance user experience and analyze Platform usage

section23.heading: 2.3 Information from Third Parties
section23.list1: Social media platforms when you connect your account
section23.list2: Professional verification services for practitioner credentials
section23.list5: Public databases for legal practitioner verification

section3.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
section3.p1: We use your information to deliver legal guidance, match you with legal practitioners, provide AI-assisted insights, and improve the Platform.
section3.p2: We also use your data for verification, analytics, communication, compliance, and security monitoring.
section3.p3: Your information may also help us personalize user experience and improve accuracy of AI responses.

list1.item2: Facilitate connections between legal seekers and practitioners
list1.item4: Provide AI-powered legal guidance and research tools
list1.item5: Enable secure communication and document sharing

list2.item1: Analyze usage patterns to enhance user experience
list2.item2: Train and improve AI models (using anonymized data)

list3.item4: Notify you of Platform updates and changes

list4.item2: Detect and prevent fraud, abuse, and illegal activities
list4.item4: Comply with legal obligations and regulations

section4.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
section4.p1: We process your personal data based on: (1) your consent, (2) the need to deliver legal services, (3) compliance with legal obligations, and (4) legitimate business interests such as fraud prevention and product improvement.

section5.title: 5. How We Share Your Information
section5.p1: We do not sell your data.
section5.p2: We may share information with vetted legal practitioners, trusted service providers, analytics partners, cloud hosting, and relevant authorities when legally required.
section5.p3: All third parties are bound by confidentiality and data-protection obligations.

list2.item1: Comply with legal processes, court orders, or government requests
list2.item3: Protect our rights, privacy, safety, or property

section6.title: 6. AI Usage & Data Handling
section6.p1: AI interactions on the Platform follow our Responsible AI Principles.
section6.p2: Your legal queries may be processed by AI models to provide preliminary guidance before a human lawyer reviews the matter.
section6.p3: We do not train AI models on your identifiable personal data.

section7.title: 7. Cookies & Tracking Technologies
section7.p1: We use cookies to enhance functionality, remember preferences, and analyze usage.
section7.p2: You may disable cookies in browser settings, but some features may stop working.

section8.title: 8. Data Storage & Retention
section8.p1: We store data securely using encryption and industry-grade protection.
section8.p2: Personal data is retained only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes described or as required by law.

list.item1: Provide our Services and maintain your account
list.item2: Comply with legal, regulatory, and tax obligations
list.item3: Resolve disputes and enforce our agreements

section9.title: 9. Your Rights
section9.p1: Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have the right to: access your data, correct it, delete it, restrict processing, or request a copy.
section9.p2: You may also object to automated decision-making or withdraw consent at any time.

section9_2.title: 9. Regional Privacy Rights
section9_2.p1: For users in the EU/EEA, we comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). You have enhanced rights including the right to lodge a complaint with your local supervisory authority.
section9_2.p2: California residents have specific rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), including the right to know what personal information is collected, sold, or disclosed, and the right to opt-out of sales.
section9_2.p3: We respect privacy rights under other applicable laws and regulations, including those in Australia, Canada, and other regions with privacy legislation.

section10.title: 10. Children’s Privacy
section10.p1: Our Platform is not intended for individuals under 18.
section10.p2: We do not knowingly collect data from minors.

section11.title: 11. Data Security
section11.p1: We implement strict security controls including encryption, access restrictions, monitoring, and secure development practices.
section11.p2: While we work hard to protect your data, no system is 100% secure.

list.item1: End-to-end encryption for sensitive communications and data transmission using industry-standard protocols (TLS/SSL)
list.item2: Strict internal access policies ensuring only authorized personnel can access personal information
list.item3: Continuous monitoring for suspicious activities and potential security threats
list.item4: Collecting only necessary information and retaining it only as long as required
list.item5: Periodic security assessments and vulnerability testing
list.item6: Regular privacy and security training for all team members

section12.title: 12. International Data Transfers
section12.p1: Your data may be stored or processed in countries with different data-protection laws.
section12.p2: We ensure adequate safeguards are in place, such as Standard Contractual Clauses or equivalent measures.

section13.title: 13. Third-Party Links
section13.p1: Our Platform may contain links to external websites.
section13.p2: We are not responsible for the privacy practices of third-party sites.

section14.title: 14. Changes to This Policy
section14.p1: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically.
section14.p2: We will notify users of material updates through the Platform or email.
